title: Is Trump too late to claim responsibility for COVID-19 in America? - Quora
tags: Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: This question is a little confusing. Has Trump even tried to claim such responsibility? If so, that would be a HUGE turn-around in attitude for him. I would have expected him to blame Obama for Trump being unready. I mean, Obama should have made all that documentation he left behind shredder-proof and fire-proof. Isn’t that what ANY responsible President would do? Trump will NEVER claim responsibility for anything that goes wrong. If he slips on a banana peel, it will be Obama’s fault. I DO hope you’re not holding your breath waiting for Trump to take any responsibility. We’ve lost enough people and, sadly, there will be more.

He did not claim responsibility for anything at the start of the pandemic. Do you imagine he will take responsibility now that 143000 people are dead and 3.8 million are infected. In case you forgot this gem, here it is again. https://www.washingtonpost.com/video/politics/i-dont-take-responsibility-at-all-trump-says-on-lack-of-coronavirus-tests/2020/03/13/bfdbdf63-784c-4392-831e-29010ae3b1ac_video.html
